attributes.type: function (struct GrantStaking.Storage storage pointer,address) view returns (bool)
function (struct GrantStaking.Storage storage pointer,address) view returns (uint256)

params.operator: The operator tokens are delegated to.

getGrantForOperator(GrantStaking.Storage.details: To avoid reverting in case the grant ID for the operator does not exist, consider calling hasGrantDelegated before.

params.operator: The operator tokens are delegate to.
The operator to which tokens from a grant are potentially delegated to.

params.grantId: Identifier of a grant from which the tokens are delegated to.
params.operator: The operator tokens are delegate to.

tryCapturingDelegationData(GrantStaking..details: In case of a delegation from the escrow, it is expected that grant ID is passed in extraData bytes array. When the delegation comes from the TokenGrant contract, delegation data are obtained directly from that contract using `tryCapturingGrantId` function.

params.extraData: Data for stake delegation, as passed to `receiveApproval` of `TokenStaking`.
params.from: The owner of the tokens who approved them to transfer.
params.operator: The operator tokens are delegated to.

canUndelegate(GrantStaking.Storage stora.notice: Returns true if msg.sender is grantee eligible to trigger stake undelegation for this operator. Function checks both standard grantee and managed grantee case.

getGrantForOperator(GrantStaking.Storage.notice: Returns grant ID for the provided operator. If the operator does not operate on stake delegated from a grant, function reverts.

hasGrantDelegated(GrantStaking.Storage s.notice: Returns true if the given operator operates on stake delegated from a grant. false is returned otherwise.

setGrantForOperator(GrantStaking.Storage.notice: Associates operator with the provided grant ID. It means that the given operator delegates on stake from the grant with this ID.

tryCapturingDelegationData(GrantStaking..notice: Tries to capture delegation data if the pending delegation has been created from a grant. There are only two possibilities and they need to be handled differently: delegation comes from the TokenGrant contract or delegation comes from TokenStakingEscrow. In those two cases grant ID has to be captured in a different way.

userdoc.notice: TokenStaking contract library allowing to capture the details of delegated grants and offering functions allowing to check grantee authentication for stake delegation management.
